content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This was a lot of fun; for me the hardest part was getting the starting position.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice and simple enough 2D grid problem that's clear and easy to understand.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple movement simulation that is visually rewarding

The test cases only have walls around the borders of the grid world. Combined with the constraint that the player will never make an invalid move, this allows clashers to skip parsing the input grid, inferring the grid at each step based purely on the size of the grid and the position of the player. Is this intended?

Goal
* Please delete "The movements assume that".

* Please add "1 unit" after "right", "left", "down" and "up".

* Consider mentioning that the player may move in both the X and Y directions at the same time (i.e. diagonally)

Input
* Line 2: Please change "players" to "player's".

* Please change "N" to "[[Height]]".

* Please change "M" to "Width".

* Please format "NumMovements" (in NumMovements Lines) as a [[variable]].

* Consider moving the characters used to represent the world to the Goal section and list each feature (walls, player, floor) on its own line.

Output
* Please add "<<[[Height]] x [[NumMovements]] Lines:>>" at the beginning.

* Please delete the last sentence as it's already mentioned in the Constraints section where it belongs.

Constraints
* Please change [[N]] to [[Width]] - 1.

* Please change [[M]] to [[Height]] - 1.

Stub generator
* Lines 3 & 6: Please change "NumInputs" to "NumMovements".

Thanks.
Thanks for your input as always.  I made the changes you suggested.

Yes.  I figured I would save clashers the extra time of writing the display for the grid and focus more on the parsing of inputs.  

With that, I do have some other ideas of where to go with this type of problem and just wanted to get something simple going first.

My code golf attempt (175 chars):

i=input
f=lambda:map(int,i().split())
_,h=f()
x,y=f()
m=int(i())
g=[];exec('g+=[list(i())];'*h)
exec('g[y][x]="_";s,t=f();x+=s;y+=t;g[y][x]="P";print(*map("".join,g),sep="\\n");'*m)

Thank you! Just two points:

Goal
* Did you mean "3 parts of" instead of "3 parts all"?

Input
* Line 2: Please change "players" to "player's".
I think I meant to include the words "of which" which rereading it I might just be better off removing that half of the sentence and just keeping "The world consists of 3 parts".
